text: my name is Tim Wallace I'm a graphics
editor for The New York Times the
security is tight here and there are
only a few official protest areas we set
up a time-lapse camera in the public
square on Wednesday to track the
movements of crowds in one of the
busiest areas where people were
protesting over the course of the day
you can see the crowds ebb and flow
there are moments during the day when
the square almost emptied at one point
the crowd cleared out when a tire blew
out the protests were peaceful but
occasionally you can see the police
forming lines across the square to
control the crowds and sometimes
separate opposing sides of protesters in
the late afternoon the center of the
square turned into a fountain which
seemed to calm protesters as they filed
out for the day
